meanings.definition: To meddle in the affairs of others.
meanings.sent1: She always likes to intermeddle in her friends' business.
meanings.sent2: It is not polite to intermeddle in someone else's personal matters.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to intermeddle in the dog's nap time, causing a playful chaos.
meanings.sent4: His attempt to intermeddle in the negotiation only added confusion to the already tense situation.
meanings.sent5: The curious child couldn't resist the urge to intermeddle in the mysterious box.

meanings.definition: To interfere in a situation where one is not welcome or needed.
meanings.sent1: Please do not intermeddle in our conversation; it is private.
meanings.sent2: He tends to intermeddle in matters that do not concern him.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel decided to intermeddle in the bird feeder, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: Her intrusive questions seemed to intermeddle in the peaceful atmosphere of the gathering.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise from the construction site began to intermeddle in the tranquility of the neighborhood.
